title: Quiz 1: Fundamentals of Communication
description: Assess your understanding of the definitions, types, and the core process of communication in nursing.

questions.question: Which term describes the transfer of meaningful information and the establishment of commonality with an audience?
questions.explanation: Communication is defined as the exchange of information between two or more persons interacting in such a way that the information is understood.

questions.question: The acronym used to remember the components of the communication process is ___BLANK___.
questions.explanation: MSCREFS stands for Message, Source, Channel, Receiver, Effects, Feedback, and Social settings.

questions.question: Match the direction of communication flow to its description:

pairs.right: Top management to lower levels (e.g., circulars)
Between heads of departments at the same level

questions.explanation: Downward is directive, Upward is feedback, and Horizontal is consultative between peers.

questions.question: Unconscious communication occurs when the sender is fully aware that their behavior is sending wrong signals to the receiver.
questions.explanation: In unconscious communication, the sender is usually UNAWARE that their behavior is sending wrong signals.

questions.question: Which of the following are characteristics of 'Formal Communication'? (Select all that apply)
questions.explanation: Formal communication is official and follows hierarchy. The grapevine and rumors describe Informal communication.

questions.question: What is the specific term used for informal, unofficial communication between groups in an organization that often contains half-truths?
questions.explanation: The 'grapevine' is the informal communication network that carries rumors and unofficial news.

questions.question: Arrange the communication flow correctly for a 'Downward' directive in a hospital:
questions.explanation: The chain of command flows from the Ministry down through Provincial and District levels to the facility staff.

questions.question: What is the primary disadvantage of 'Downward Communication'?

options.text: It is unidirectional with delayed feedback

questions.explanation: Downward communication is one-way (unidirectional), meaning there is no immediate return path for feedback.
questions.hint: Does information easily flow back up?

questions.question: Mass communication is typically used for which of the following scenarios in health? (Select all that apply)
questions.explanation: Mass communication reaches many people at once, suitable for public health campaigns and emergencies, not private patient data.
